cypherfox wrote:
> Greetings,
> I asked about a few feature enhancements, or more accurately
> if anyone had any reasons they shouldn't be done, or what
> testing paradigm I might be missing that made them wrong...

Well, the paradigm that Junit follows and with which you seem to have
problems is that a testcase should be a full standalone test scenario
and shouldn't depend at the results of other testcases at all.

It might be that you are fallen into the "a test method should test a
single method call" trap (it shouldn't, it should test a single, simple
test scenario); or perhaps your tests are too big and more on the
functional side than the unit side to be handled effectively using
Junit.

What do you think?

Cheers, Ilja
